page.title: 09The Police, Alston Moor
page.content: The{Police Station}was built during the 19th century. It contains two offices, cells, a court room, a magistrates' retiring room and toilets on the ground floor, while on the upper floor there is a flat where the sergeant and his family live. As well as the{sergeant,}there are two {constables}stationed in Alston and there are four{special constables. They cover an area of 70 square miles.They do shift work and sometimes work at night. They are responsible for traffic control, crime investigation, general enquiries which include fire-outs, accidents and rescuing motorists stranded in the snow in winter. They also teach children road safety and how to cycle properly. The{court}is in session on the first Friday of every month and there are three{magistrates.
